misdeed: The mournful cries of a child echo through a small village at night, but the source of the sound remains elusive. People are plagued by feelings of unease and dread, and some claim to have seen a shadowy figure flitting through the graveyard.
solution: The Vaesen is a Myling and can be put to rest by finding its body, burying it in consecrated ground, and giving it someone else’s name.

clues.description: The cries seem to be coming from the vicinity of a recently disturbed grave in the local churchyard.
Locals whisper tales of a woman who took her own child’s life many years ago, burying it in unconsecrated ground.
A chilling wind blows through the village at night, carrying with it the scent of freshly turned earth and decay.
A small, child-sized handprint is found etched in the frost on a villager's window.
Black feathers, too large to belong to any local bird, are found scattered near the disturbed grave.
The mournful cries seem to intensify whenever someone tries to leave the village, as if the unseen presence seeks to prevent them from escaping its torment.

plotTwist.description: The village priest, haunted by a past sin, has accidentally awakened the Vaesen while tending to the gravesite of an unbaptized child he secretly fathered.
